Despite destruction and death, Israelis widely support war against Iran
subhead: The overwhelming majority of the population supports Israel's strikes against Iran, partly because of the nuclear threat but also the hope for regional peace if the regime in Tehran collapses.

In Sweden, Europe's first decarbonized steel mill rises, stirring hope and doubt
subhead: Eighty kilometers from the Arctic Circle, the Stegra plant is set to produce steel from 'green' hydrogen by late 2026. However, government reluctance is making the project's realization harder than expected.
byline: By Bastien Bonnefous (Boden, Sweden, special correspondent)

title: Blanketing an entire continent with forests: Why planting trees cannot make up for fossil fuel emissions
subhead: A new study assesses the cost of carbon offsetting, a practice increasingly used by oil and gas companies, and calculates the amount of land that would need to be covered with forests if all coal, oil, and gas reserves worldwide were burned.

title: Guy Savoy, Michelin-starred chef: 'At 15, I spent all my summer holidays cooking at a refreshment stand'
subhead: 'I wouldn't be where I am today if...' In this series, Le Monde interviews a personality about a decisive moment in their life. The multi-Michelin-starred chef recalls the flavors of his childhood in the local public garden, where his parents worked.

title: Paris extends summer bar and restaurant terrace hours, angering noise-weary neighbors
subhead: The measure, which starts on June 21 and lasts until September 14, also faces criticism from right-wing and centrist opposition members on the city council of the French capital.

How Trump broke with his strategic allies to side with Russia over Ukraine
subhead: 'The Transatlantic Divorce' (5/5). After Barack Obama stepped back during the 2014 annexation of Crimea and Joe Biden hesitated, Donald Trump, now back in the White House, aligned himself with Russia at the UN and left his strategic allies alone to face Vladimir Putin.

title: How close is Iran to having nuclear weapons?
subhead: Israel has bombed strategic sites in Iran, which it said could soon produce a nuclear weapon. Tehran had announced it was increasing its production of enriched uranium, amid stalled talks with the United States.
byline: By Pierre Breteau, Zoé Multeau and Manon Romain

title: Limiting global warming to 1.5°C is now impossible
subhead: According to a group of scientists, the target set by the 2015 Paris Agreement can no longer be met due to the inability of countries to reduce greenhouse gas emissions.
